ground_truth: At the graveside, Benjamin turns to Mrs. Maple's dog, and Daisy watches as he says his goodbyes. Tizzy shakes hands with Benjamin, and Queenie hugs him. Red-haired Daisy watches as he heads off. Carrying a kit bag and a suitcase, Benjamin, who now looks in his late 60s, walks along the sidewalk until he gets to the end of the road. He stops and sees Daisy running after him, but she turns and runs back down the street. Benjamin carries on up the road. In the hospital, Caroline opens a box full of old postcards tied up with ribbon. Meanwhile, Daisy does a pirouette. Captain Mike and Benjamin are on the snow-covered deck, where Mike points to a tattoo on his chest and makes a figure of eight with his hand. The twins start to fight. In an elevator, Benjamin now looks in his 50s. To Benjamin, as he follows them out of the lift. Back on the snow-covered deck of the tugboat, the tug is towing a gigantic ship. Later, Benjamin lies in bed in the hotel and finds Elizabeth in the lobby of the hotel. She's sitting on a sofa, a dressing gown over her nightdress, reading. Benjamin, in his dressing gown, heads towards the kitchen, then turns back to her. He goes through to the kitchen and Elizabeth stares after him, closes the magazine she was reading, and gets to her feet. She peers into the kitchen, where Benjamin is busy making the tea, and walks in as Benjamin looks up. Elizabeth opens her mouth as if about to say something. Benjamin goes over to her worktop and picks up two Russian tea glasses and their holders, puts the fly-ridden honey pot down, and carries the tea glasses and the teapot over to a table. Elizabeth takes a seat as Benjamin pours the tea. Benjamin sits down, and they eye each other across the table. Elizabeth wags her forefinger, and Benjamin checks on the teapot. Elizabeth looks a little awkward as he pours her a cup, which she sips thoughtfully. They share a smile, sip their tea, and both smile again. Heavy snow falls over the tugboat. Later, Benjamin comes downstairs, and Elizabeth gets up to greet him, looking a little flustered as she turns to Benjamin and heads off. In the hospital, at the ballet school, young Daisy reads Benjamin's card and, looking sad, she dances with other students in front of a panel of judges. At night in the hotel, Benjamin comes downstairs into the lobby and finds Elizabeth wearing an evening dress. They sit at a table in the hotel dining room where Benjamin tentatively tries a spoonful of caviar.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: At the graveside, Benjamin turns to Mrs. Maple's hound, and Daisy observes as he bids his farewells. Tizzy clasps hands with Benjamin, and Queenie embraces him. Red-haired Daisy observes as he heads away. Carrying a kit bag and a suitcase, Benjamin, who now appears in his late 60s, strolls along the pavement until he gets to the end of the street. He pauses and perceives Daisy sprinting after him, but she turns and dashes back down the lane. Benjamin continues up the street. In the hospital, Caroline opens a container full of old postcards bound up with ribbon. Meanwhile, Daisy performs a pirouette. Captain Mike and Benjamin are on the snow-covered deck, where Mike indicates a tattoo on his chest and makes a figure of eight with his hand. The twins commence to brawl. In an elevator, Benjamin now appears in his 50s. To Benjamin, as he trails them out of the lift. Back on the snow-covered deck of the tugboat, the tug is hauling a gigantic vessel. Later, Benjamin reclines in bed in the hotel and finds Elizabeth in the lobby of the hotel. She's sitting on a couch, a dressing gown over her nightdress, perusing. Benjamin, in his dressing gown, heads towards the kitchen, then turns back to her. He proceeds through to the kitchen and Elizabeth gazes after him, closes the magazine she was perusing, and rises to her feet. She peers into the kitchen, where Benjamin is busy preparing the tea, and walks in as Benjamin glances up. Elizabeth opens her mouth as if about to utter something. Benjamin goes over to her countertop and picks up two Russian tea glasses and their holders, places the fly-ridden honey pot down, and conveys the tea glasses and the teapot over to a table. Elizabeth takes a seat as Benjamin pours the tea. Benjamin sits down, and they regard each other across the table. Elizabeth wags her forefinger, and Benjamin checks on the teapot. Elizabeth appears a little awkward as he pours her a cup, which she sips contemplatively. They share a smile, sip their tea, and both smile again. Heavy snow descends over the tugboat. Later, Benjamin comes downstairs, and Elizabeth rises to greet him, appearing a little flustered as she turns to Benjamin and heads away. In the hospital, at the ballet school, young Daisy reads Benjamin's card and, appearing sad, she dances with other students in front of a panel of judges. At night in the hotel, Benjamin comes downstairs into the lobby and finds Elizabeth wearing an evening gown. They sit at a table in the hotel dining room where Benjamin tentatively tries a spoonful of caviar.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: At the graveside, Mrs. Maple's dog is turned to by Benjamin, and as he says his goodbyes, he is watched by Daisy. Hands are shaken with Benjamin by Tizzy, and he is hugged by Queenie. As he heads off, he is watched by red-haired Daisy. A kit bag and a suitcase are carried by Benjamin, who, now looking in his late 60s, walks along the sidewalk until the end of the road is reached by him. He stops and sees Daisy running after him, but she turns and runs back down the street. The road is continued up by Benjamin. In the hospital, a box full of old postcards tied up with ribbon is opened by Caroline. Meanwhile, a pirouette is done by Daisy. Captain Mike and Benjamin are on the snow-covered deck, where a tattoo on his chest is pointed to by Mike, and a figure of eight is made with his hand. A fight is started by the twins. In an elevator, Benjamin is now looking in his 50s. He follows them out of the lift. Back on the snow-covered deck of the tugboat, a gigantic ship is being towed by the tug. Later, in the hotel, Benjamin lies in bed and Elizabeth is found by him in the lobby. She's sitting on a sofa, a dressing gown is over her nightdress, reading. In his dressing gown, the kitchen is headed towards by Benjamin, then he turns back to her. The kitchen is gone through by him, and after him, Elizabeth stares, closes the magazine she was reading, and gets to her feet. The kitchen is peered into by her, where the tea is being made by Benjamin, and as he looks up, she walks in. As if about to say something, Elizabeth opens her mouth. The worktop is gone over to by Benjamin, two Russian tea glasses and their holders are picked up by him, the fly-ridden honey pot is put down, and the tea glasses and the teapot are carried over to a table by him. A seat is taken by Elizabeth as the tea is poured by Benjamin. Benjamin sits down, and across the table, they eye each other. Her forefinger is wagged by Elizabeth, and the teapot is checked by Benjamin. As he pours her a cup, which is sipped thoughtfully by her, Elizabeth looks a little awkward. A smile is shared by them, they sip their tea, and again both smile. Over the tugboat, heavy snow falls. Later, downstairs comes Benjamin, and he is greeted by Elizabeth, who gets up, looks a little flustered as she turns to him, and heads off. In the hospital, at the ballet school, Benjamin's card is read by young Daisy, and looking sad, she dances with other students in front of a panel of judges. At night in the hotel, downstairs comes Benjamin into the lobby, and Elizabeth is found by him wearing an evening dress. At a table in the hotel dining room, they sit where a spoonful of caviar is tentatively tried by Benjamin.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: At the graveside, Benjamin bids farewell to Mrs. Maple's dog, while Daisy observes. Tizzy shakes Benjamin's hand, and Queenie hugs him. Red-haired Daisy watches as he leaves. Carrying a kit bag and suitcase, Benjamin, now appearing in his late 60s, walks down the sidewalk, stopping when Daisy runs toward him but then turns back. In the hospital, Caroline opens a box of old postcards. Meanwhile, Daisy does a pirouette. Captain Mike and Benjamin stand on a snow-covered deck; Mike points to a chest tattoo and gestures with a figure eight. The twins fight. In an elevator, Benjamin looks in his 50s. Back on the tugboat, it tows a massive ship. Later, in a hotel, Benjamin finds Elizabeth in the lobby, dressed in a gown, reading. In a dressing gown, he heads to the kitchen, and Elizabeth follows. Benjamin prepares tea, and they share a thoughtful sip and smile. Heavy snow falls on the tugboat. Later, Benjamin greets Elizabeth, who looks flustered. In the hospital, at ballet school, young Daisy reads Benjamin's card, appearing sad, and dances before judges. At night in the hotel, Benjamin finds Elizabeth in an evening dress, and they sit and dine, with Benjamin trying caviar.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: At the graveside, Benjamin says goodbye to Mrs. Maple's dog as Daisy watches. Tizzy shakes his hand, and Queenie hugs him. Red-haired Daisy runs after Benjamin but retreats. Benjamin, appearing in his late 60s, walks with a kit bag and suitcase. In the hospital, Caroline opens a box of old postcards. Daisy pirouettes. On the snowy deck, Captain Mike shows a tattoo to Benjamin, and the twins fight. Benjamin, looking in his 50s, leaves an elevator. On the tugboat's snow-covered deck, it tows a huge ship. Later, Benjamin finds Elizabeth in the hotel lobby, wearing a dressing gown over her nightdress. In the kitchen, he makes tea. They sit, sipping tea and exchanging smiles. Heavy snow covers the tugboat, as Benjamin later encounters Elizabeth, who seems flustered. At the ballet school, young Daisy reads Benjamin's card, dances sadly for judges. At night in the hotel, Benjamin meets Elizabeth in an evening dress, and they dine, where he tries caviar hesitantly.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: At the solemn graveside, Benjamin turns his attention to Mrs. Maple's dog, and with a heartfelt demeanor, Daisy observes him as he tenderly says his goodbyes. Tizzy extends a formal handshake to Benjamin, and Queenie embraces him warmly. Red-haired Daisy, with an unwavering gaze, watches him as he prepares to depart. Laden with a kit bag and a suitcase, Benjamin, who now appears to be in his late 60s, steadily walks along the sidewalk until he reaches the very end of the road. He pauses momentarily and sees Daisy running towards him, but she abruptly turns and makes her way back down the street. Unperturbed, Benjamin continues on his path up the road. Meanwhile, within the sterile environment of the hospital, Caroline opens a box filled with old postcards neatly tied up with ribbon. At the same time, Daisy gracefully performs a pirouette. On the snow-covered deck, Captain Mike and Benjamin stand side by side as Mike gestures to a tattoo on his chest and makes a figure of eight with his hand in the cold air. The twins, in a sudden burst of energy, begin to fight. Inside an elevator, Benjamin now looks as though he is in his 50s, following the twins out of the lift. Once again, back on the snow-covered deck of the tugboat, the powerful vessel is diligently towing a gigantic ship. Later on, Benjamin lies in a bed within the hotel, and soon finds Elizabeth in the lobby, where she sits on a sofa clad in a dressing gown over her nightdress, engaged in reading. Clad in his own dressing gown, Benjamin heads towards the kitchen but then hesitantly turns back to her. He proceeds to the kitchen, while Elizabeth, putting her magazine aside, rises to her feet and peeks into the kitchen where Benjamin is busily preparing tea. She walks in as Benjamin looks up to meet her gaze. Elizabeth seems about to speak as she opens her mouth. Benjamin steps over to the worktop, picking up two Russian tea glasses along with their ornate holders, sets down the fly-ridden honey pot, and carefully carries the tea glasses and the teapot to a nearby table. Elizabeth takes a seat as Benjamin attentively pours the tea. He joins her at the table, and their eyes meet across the surface. Elizabeth wags her forefinger, prompting Benjamin to check on the teapot. Elizabeth appears slightly awkward as he pours her a cup, which she thoughtfully sips. They share a gentle smile, continue sipping their tea, and exchange another smile. Outside, heavy snow blankets the tugboat. Later, Benjamin comes downstairs, and Elizabeth, appearing a bit flustered, rises to greet him. She turns to him and heads off. In the hospital, at the ballet school, young Daisy reads Benjamin's card and, with a hint of sadness, dances alongside other students before a panel of discerning judges. As night falls over the hotel, Benjamin descends the stairs into the lobby to find Elizabeth dressed elegantly in an evening gown. They sit together at a table in the hotel dining room, where Benjamin, with some hesitation, tastes a spoonful of caviar.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: At the solemn and quiet graveside, Benjamin shifts his focus to Mrs. Maple's dog, and with a heartfelt and sincere demeanor, Daisy watches him closely as he gently says his goodbyes. Tizzy then extends a formal handshake to Benjamin, while Queenie offers him a warm and affectionate embrace. Red-haired Daisy, maintaining her unwavering and steady gaze, follows him with her eyes as he prepares to make his departure. Laden with both a kit bag and an additional suitcase, Benjamin, who now gives the impression of being in his late 60s, walks steadily and deliberately along the sidewalk until he reaches the very end of the road. There, he pauses momentarily and notices Daisy running towards him, but she abruptly changes direction and makes her way back down the street. Unbothered and undeterred, Benjamin continues on his path up the road. Meanwhile, within the sterile and clinical environment of the hospital, Caroline opens a box that is filled with old postcards meticulously tied up with ribbon. At the same time, Daisy performs a graceful pirouette with elegance. On the snow-covered deck, Captain Mike and Benjamin stand side by side, as Mike gestures dramatically to a tattoo on his chest and makes a figure of eight with his hand in the crisp, cold air. The twins, in a sudden burst of exuberant energy, begin to fight with each other. Inside an elevator, Benjamin now appears as though he is in his 50s, following the twins as they exit the lift. Once again, back on the snow-covered deck of the tugboat, the powerful vessel is diligently towing a gigantic ship. Later on, Benjamin lies in a bed within the confines of the hotel and soon finds Elizabeth sitting in the lobby, where she sits on a sofa clad in a dressing gown over her nightdress, deeply engaged in reading. Clad in his own dressing gown, Benjamin heads towards the kitchen but then hesitantly turns back to her. He proceeds to the kitchen, while Elizabeth, putting her magazine aside, rises to her feet and peers into the kitchen where Benjamin is busily preparing tea. She walks in as Benjamin looks up to meet her gaze. Elizabeth seems ready to speak as she opens her mouth. Benjamin steps over to the worktop, picking up two Russian tea glasses along with their ornate holders, sets down the fly-ridden honey pot, and carefully carries the tea glasses and the teapot to a nearby table. Elizabeth then takes a seat as Benjamin attentively pours the tea. He joins her at the table, and their eyes meet across the surface. Elizabeth wags her forefinger, prompting Benjamin to check on the teapot. Elizabeth appears slightly awkward as he pours her a cup, which she thoughtfully sips. They share a gentle smile, continue sipping their tea, and exchange another smile, creating a moment of warmth. Outside, heavy snow blankets the tugboat. Later, Benjamin descends downstairs, and Elizabeth, appearing a bit flustered, rises to greet him. She turns to him and heads off. In the hospital, at the ballet school, young Daisy reads Benjamin's card and, with a hint of sadness, dances alongside other students before a panel of discerning judges. As night gently falls over the hotel, Benjamin descends the stairs into the lobby to find Elizabeth dressed elegantly in an exquisite evening gown. They sit together at a table in the hotel's dining room, where Benjamin, with some degree of hesitation, tastes a spoonful of caviar.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: At the graveside, Benjamin stands solemnly and turns his attention to Mrs. Maple's dog, offering it a tender farewell as Daisy quietly observes from a distance, noting his affectionate gesture. Tizzy steps forward and extends his hand to Benjamin, who accepts it with a firm handshake, a silent acknowledgment of their camaraderie. Queenie approaches next, wrapping her arms around Benjamin in a warm embrace, conveying her support and care. With red hair catching the light, Daisy watches intently as Benjamin, burdened with a kit bag and a suitcase, begins his solitary journey. He walks at a steady pace along the sidewalk, his appearance now that of a man in his late 60s, until he reaches the end of the road where he pauses. There, he catches sight of Daisy running toward him, her movements full of urgency. However, she falters and abruptly turns back, retreating down the street, leaving Benjamin to resume his path. At the hospital, Caroline delicately opens a box, revealing a treasure trove of old postcards meticulously tied together with a ribbon, each card a silent witness to history. Meanwhile, Daisy, with an air of grace, performs a pirouette, her movements full of elegance. Captain Mike and Benjamin find themselves on a snow-covered deck, where Captain Mike gestures to a tattoo on his chest, using his hand to trace a figure of eight in the air, a silent message laden with meaning. Suddenly, a pair of twins burst into a scuffle, their actions a contrast to the serene surroundings. In an elevator, Benjamin appears transformed, now looking like a man in his 50s, observing as the doors open and he follows others out, stepping into a new scene. Back on the frosty deck of the tugboat, the vessel labors as it tows a gigantic ship, the scene framed by the harsh winter backdrop. Later, Benjamin reclines in a hotel bed, lost in thought, before venturing into the lobby where he discovers Elizabeth seated on a sofa. Draped in a dressing gown over her nightdress, Elizabeth is absorbed in her reading. Benjamin, dressed similarly in a dressing gown, makes his way to the kitchen, only to hesitate and turn back to Elizabeth, contemplating the moment. Eventually, he proceeds into the kitchen, setting about the task of making tea as Elizabeth's curious gaze follows him. She closes her magazine, rises from her seat, and approaches the kitchen, where Benjamin, noticing her presence, glances up. Elizabeth opens her mouth as if about to speak, but Benjamin is already in motion, reaching for the worktop to retrieve two Russian tea glasses and their accompanying holders. He sets down the honey pot, now attracting flies, and carries the tea glasses and teapot over to a table. Elizabeth settles into a chair as Benjamin begins pouring the tea, their eyes meeting across the table. Elizabeth playfully wags her forefinger, prompting Benjamin to check on the teapot. He pours her a cup, observing her as she sips it thoughtfully, while Elizabeth appears slightly awkward. Despite the initial tension, they exchange smiles, savor their tea, and share another smile, each moment deepening their silent connection. As heavy snow blankets the tugboat, the scene shifts to a later time, with Benjamin descending the stairs. Elizabeth, appearing slightly flustered, rises to greet him and quickly turns to lead the way. At the hospital, at the ballet school, young Daisy reads the card from Benjamin, her expression tinged with sadness. She joins other students on stage, dancing gracefully before a panel of discerning judges. That night, in the hotel, Benjamin descends into the lobby once more to find Elizabeth elegantly dressed in an evening gown. Together, they take their seats at a table in the hotel dining room, and Benjamin ventures to try a spoonful of caviar, his movements tentative yet curious.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
At the graveside, Benjamin bids farewell to Mrs. Maple's dog and receives a handshake from Tizzy and a hug from Queenie, as red-haired Daisy observes him leaving. With a kit bag and suitcase, Benjamin, appearing in his late 60s, walks along the sidewalk to the road's end, noticing Daisy briefly running toward him before retreating. Continuing on, Benjamin reflects as Caroline opens a box of old postcards in the hospital, while Daisy practices a pirouette. On the snow-covered deck, Captain Mike shows Benjamin his tattoo and gestures. The scene shifts to twins fighting. In the elevator, Benjamin appears in his 50s, exiting as he follows the group.

Back on the snow-covered tugboat deck, the tugboat tows a huge ship. Later at a hotel, Benjamin, now in a dressing gown, finds Elizabeth in the lobby, reading. He moves to the kitchen, prompting Elizabeth to follow him. Benjamin prepares tea, placing two Russian tea glasses on the table, as Elizabeth observes him, then takes a seat. He pours her a cup, and they exchange smiles over tea, sharing a moment of connection. Heavy snow envelops the tugboat. Subsequently, Benjamin comes downstairs, greeted by a flustered Elizabeth.

Meanwhile, at the ballet school in the hospital, young Daisy reads a card from Benjamin and, despite looking sad, dances for judges with her peers. Later, at night in the hotel, Benjamin finds Elizabeth in an evening dress in the lobby. They sit in the dining room, where Benjamin cautiously tastes caviar.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: At the graveside during a somber autumn morning, Benjamin turns to Mrs. Maple's dog, a loyal terrier that had been her companion for over a decade, and Daisy watches as he says his goodbyes. Tizzy, an old family friend who used to babysit Benjamin, shakes hands with him, and Queenie, who had taken care of Benjamin when he was a child, hugs him. Red-haired Daisy, an aspiring ballet dancer known for her grace, watches as he heads off. Carrying a well-worn kit bag that had accompanied him on many journeys and a vintage leather suitcase, Benjamin, who now looks in his late 60s, walks along the sidewalk lined with maple trees until he gets to the end of the road. He stops and sees Daisy running after him, but she, reminded of her upcoming dance class, turns and runs back down the street. Benjamin carries on up the road, feeling the weight of the years. In the hospital, Caroline, a lifelong collector of memorabilia, opens a box full of old postcards featuring famous landmarks from around the world, tied up with a weathered ribbon. Meanwhile, Daisy, rehearsing for her next ballet performance, does a pirouette with precision. Captain Mike, a seasoned sailor with tales of high seas adventures, and Benjamin are on the snow-covered deck of a sturdy tugboat, where Mike points to a tattoo on his chest symbolizing his first voyage and makes a figure of eight with his hand, indicating infinity or endless journeys. The twins, known for their playful antics, start to fight. In an elevator, with walls adorned by art deco designs, Benjamin now looks in his 50s. To Benjamin, as he follows them out of the lift. Back on the snow-covered deck of the tugboat, the tug is towing a gigantic ship, a cargo liner bound for distant shores. Later, Benjamin lies in a vintage-inspired room in the hotel and finds Elizabeth in the lobby of the hotel. She's sitting on a plush sofa, a dressing gown over her nightdress, reading an old classic novel. Benjamin, in his cozy dressing gown, heads towards the kitchen, then turns back to her. He goes through to the kitchen, equipped with retro appliances, and Elizabeth stares after him, closes the fashion magazine she was reading, and gets to her feet. She peers into the kitchen, where Benjamin is busy making the tea with a calming routine, and walks in as Benjamin looks up. Elizabeth opens her mouth as if about to say something meaningful. Benjamin goes over to her worktop, which is cluttered with spices and teas, and picks up two intricately designed Russian tea glasses and their holders, puts the fly-ridden honey pot down, and carries the tea glasses and the teapot over to a small rustic table. Elizabeth takes a seat as Benjamin pours the tea, fragrant with hints of bergamot. Benjamin sits down, and they eye each other across the table, their expressions softening. Elizabeth wags her forefinger, gently reminding him of an inside joke, and Benjamin checks on the teapot. Elizabeth looks a little awkward as he pours her a cup, which she sips thoughtfully, savoring the warmth. They share a smile, sip their tea, and both smile again, feeling a quiet connection. Heavy snow falls over the tugboat, creating a serene landscape. Later, Benjamin comes downstairs, and Elizabeth gets up to greet him, looking a little flustered as she turns to Benjamin and heads off, her mind on their shared past. In the hospital, at the prestigious ballet school, young Daisy reads Benjamin's card, a heartfelt message of encouragement, and, looking sad yet determined, she dances with other students in front of a panel of judges, hoping to win a scholarship. At night in the hotel, Benjamin comes downstairs into the elegant lobby and finds Elizabeth wearing an evening dress, reminiscent of old Hollywood glamour. They sit at a table in the hotel dining room, which is softly lit by vintage chandeliers, where Benjamin tentatively tries a spoonful of caviar, a delicacy he's never had before, savoring its rich, salty flavor.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. Later Benjamin comes downstairs and Elizabeth gets up to greet him looking a little flustered as she turns to Benjamin and heads off. In the hospital at the ballet school young Daisy reads Benjamin's card and looking sad. she dances with other students in front of a panel of judges. At night in the hotel Benjamin comes downstairs into the lobby and finds Elizabeth wearing an evening dress. They sit at a table in the hotel dining room where Benjamin tentatively tries a spoonful of caviar.

In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. He goes through to the kitchen and Elizabeth stares after him closes the magazine she was reading and gets to her feet. She peers into the kitchen where Benjamin is busy making the tea and walks in as Benjamin looks up. Elizabeth opens her mouth as if about to say something. Benjamin goes over to her worktop and picks up two Russian tea glasses and their holders puts the flyridden honey pot down and carries the tea glasses and the teapot over to a table. Elizabeth takes a seat as Benjamin pours the tea. Benjamin sits down and they eye each other across the table. Elizabeth wags her forefinger and Benjamin checks on the teapot. Elizabeth looks a little awkward as he pours her a cup which she sips thoughtfully. They share a smile sip their tea and both smile again. Heavy snow falls over the tugboat. Later Benjamin comes downstairs and Elizabeth gets up to greet him looking a little flustered as she turns to Benjamin and heads off. In the hospital at the ballet school young Daisy reads Benjamin's card and looking sad. she dances with other students in front of a panel of judges. At night in the hotel Benjamin comes downstairs into the lobby and finds Elizabeth wearing an evening dress. They sit at a table in the hotel dining room where Benjamin tentatively tries a spoonful of caviar.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: At the graveside Benjamin turns to Mrs Maple's dog and Daisy watches as he says his goodbyes. Tizzy shakes hands with Benjamin and Queenie hugs him. Redhaired Daisy watches as he heads off. Carrying a kit bag and a suitcase Benjamin who now looks in his late 60s walks along the sidewalk until he gets to the end of the road. He stops and sees Daisy running after him but she turns and runs back down the street. Benjamin carries on up the road. In the hospital Caroline opens a box full of old postcards tied up with ribbon. Meanwhile Daisy does a pirouette. They share a smile sip their tea and both smile again. Heavy snow falls over the tugboat. Later Benjamin comes downstairs and Elizabeth gets up to greet him looking a little flustered as she turns to Benjamin and heads off. In the hospital at the ballet school young Daisy reads Benjamin's card and looking sad. she dances with other students in front of a panel of judges. At night in the hotel Benjamin comes downstairs into the lobby and finds Elizabeth wearing an evening dress. They sit at a table in the hotel dining room where Benjamin tentatively tries a spoonful of caviar.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: At the orchard, Jasper nods to Mr. Juniper's cat, and Lucy observes as he shares his greetings. Mopsy waves paws with Jasper, and Ladybug pats him. Blonde-haired Lucy observes as he drifts away. Carrying a sack and a duffel, Jasper, who now resembles someone in his late 70s, skips along the trail until he gets to the end of the path. He pauses and notices Lucy skipping after him, but she turns and skips back down the lane. Jasper marches on up the path. In the studio, Penelope peeks into a crate stuffed with old brochures tied up with twine. Meanwhile, Lucy executes a cartwheel. Captain Joe and Jasper are on the ice-covered raft, where Joe gestures to a necklace on his ankle and traces a circle with his elbow. The siblings commence to wrestle. In a corridor, Jasper now resembles someone in his 40s. To Jasper, as he trails them out of the escalator. Back on the ice-covered raft of the barge, the barge is dragging a colossal raft. Later, Jasper rests in the chamber in the hostel and discovers Matilda in the lounge of the hostel. She's perched on a stool, a cloak over her jumpsuit, scribbling. Jasper, in his cloak, ambles towards the pantry, then swivels back to her. He ambles through to the pantry, and Matilda gazes after him, folds the leaflet she was reading, and rises. She peers into the pantry, where Jasper is occupied crafting the cider, and strolls in as Jasper glances up. Matilda parts her lips as though about to utter something. Jasper moves to her counter and grips two German cider mugs and their sleeves, sets the dusty sugar jar down, and transports the cider mugs and the cider jug over to a counter. Matilda reclines as Jasper dispenses the cider. Jasper settles down, and they examine each other across the counter. Matilda wags her pinkie, and Jasper inspects the cider jug. Matilda appears slightly embarrassed as he dispenses her a glass, which she quaffs pensively. They exchange a grin, sip their cider, and both chuckle again. Heavy frost descends over the barge. Later, Jasper steps downstairs, and Matilda rises to meet him, appearing slightly unsettled as she turns to Jasper and drifts away. In the studio, at the gymnastics academy, young Lucy peruses Jasper's memo and, feeling somber, she flips with other acrobats in front of a panel of officials. At dusk in the hostel, Jasper descends into the lounge and discovers Matilda clad in a formal gown. They perch at a counter in the hostel dining area where Jasper cautiously samples a nibble of escargot.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: At the graveside, Benjamin says his goodbyes to Mrs. Maple's dog and Tizzy, while Queenie hugs him. Daisy watches as he walks away with his belongings. She starts to follow him but then retreats. Meanwhile, Caroline opens a box of old postcards. On a snow-covered deck, Captain Mike shows Benjamin a tattoo. Later, Benjamin, now in his 50s, is on a tugboat towing a ship. Returning to a hotel, he finds Elizabeth and they share tea, exchanging smiles across the table. Heavy snow falls on the tugboat. In the hospital, young Daisy reads a card from Benjamin and dances sadly at ballet school. At night, Benjamin joins Elizabeth in the hotel dining room, trying caviar.
